name: Jamala
description: '''Susana Alimivna Jamaladinova'''{{efn|[[Crimean Tatar language|Crimean Tatar]]: {{lang|crh-Latn|Susana Alim qızı Camaladinova}}; {{langx|uk|Суса́на Алі́мівна Джамаладі́нова|Susána Alímivna Dzhamaladínova}}, {{IPA|uk|sʊˈsɑnɐ ɐˈl⁽ʲ⁾imiu̯nɐ dʒɐmɐlɐˈd⁽ʲ⁾inowɐ|IPA}}; {{lang-rus|Суса́на Али́мовна Джамалади́нова|Susána Alímovna Dzhamaladínova|sʊˈsanə ɐˈlʲiməvnə dʐəməlɐˈdʲinəvə|links=yes}}.}} (born 27 August 1983), known professionally as '''Jamala''',{{efn|Crimean Tatar: {{lang|crh-Latn|Camala}}, also spelt {{lang|crh|Джамала}} in Cyrillic; {{langx|uk|Джама́ла|links=no}}, {{IPA|uk|dʒɐˈmɑlɐ|IPA}}; {{lang-rus|Джама́ла||dʐɐˈmalə|links=no}}.}} is a Ukrainian singer. She represented {{Esccnty|Ukraine|y=2016}} and won the [[Eurovision Song Contest 2016]] with her song "[[1944 (song)|1944]]". In 2017, 2018, 2019, 2022, 2023 and 2024 she served as a judge at ''[[Vidbir]]'', the Ukrainian national selection for the Eurovision Song Contest. In November 2023, Russia added Jamala to its wanted list.
